intro: Icacorea alstonii, commonly known as the Alston's hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and yellow. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are ovate and have a rough texture, while the stems are woody and often covered in fine hairs. Icacorea alstonii thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in humid, tropical climates.
